text: In this video,

we'll show you three
ways to change the color
of your Instagram Stories background.

We'll show you how to use
editing tools on your story post,
how to use the create tool,
and using premade backgrounds.
Instagram gives you the option
to customize your story post
by adding text to your post.
Select a photo -- one you're tagged in
or one from your library to upload.
Edit the image by pinching the screen
to adjust the photo size.

In the story draft screen,
tap the scribble icon.
Tap the pen tool before choosing a color
from the bottom menu bar.
This will allow you to add text.
To add opaque text to your post,

tap the highlighter icon
before selecting a color.
Tap and hold the slider on the screen
to adjust the brush sizes.

This is helpful when you are
coloring your story post.
To add neon-colored text,

hit the wand icon before
selecting a color.
Tap the eraser icon to reveal a part
of the post hidden by text or color.

You can always hit the undo
button to reverse an action.

There's an easy way to
create a story background
if you'd like to just add text.
On the Instagram homepage,
tap the story icon or swipe right.

Tap the font icon to create
a blank Instagram story.

Tap the colored circle
from the bottom menu
to change the background color.
Select your desired tool to add text
and graphics to the background.
Instagram makes it easy
to upload a photo from your library

to use as the background
of your Instagram story.
On Instagram, tap your story
and open your photo gallery.

Choose your desired
photo and use two fingers

to expand the background
over the entire screen.
Customize your story as you want.
And tap the check to save your changes.
Now you are ready to post your story
with a customized background.
